result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence.  Release for inmate work assignments and the Day Reporting Center.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Credit for six days 2/10/2015 to 2/15/2015.

miscConds.notes:
fine is set at zero.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.

Notify DOC agent of all prescription within three days of receiving prescription from any doctor.
Fill all prescriptions within three days of receiving prescription from any doctor.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Must attend at least two alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit.  Release for work and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  The condition time may be served in Manitowoc County if approved by Manitowoc County. 
This is STAYED for use as follows for positive drug or alcohol test violations:  first violation to serve seven (7) days; 14 days for second; and 21 days for third.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 230 Days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 6 days (2-10-2015 to 2-15-2015). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 days of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 42 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for  work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. The condition time may be served in Manitowoc County if approved by Manitowoc County. -This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 7 days.
*Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 14 days.
*Third violation of positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 21 days.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Justin J Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  AS TO COUNT  1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Defendant Justin J Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing. Defense requesting additional time for deferrend prosecution agreement. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin J Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defense counsel received discovery and offer. Court does not object to case being transferred if appoved by court. Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin J Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for scheduling conference. Court is down. Defense has discovery but has not received an offer.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin J Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Dennis Murphy for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-26-2015 at 01:30 pm.
